location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Benjamin Jervis, East India Company Resident at Bushere [Bushire], to Peter Elwin Wrench, East India Company Agent at Bussora [Basra]

mods.abstract: The letter questions a couple of rumours from various sources. The first that Sheikh Soliman of the Kaâ€˜b tribe has taken an English sloop and Captain Phillips of the Sally.The second that a fleet of Company ships has arrived at Muscat with the mission of retrieving the lost treasure of the Islamabad. The letter also reports that the Tartarhas been withdrawn from Corgo [Khargu] and sails to India, and that Carem Khaun [Karim Khan] has left camp for Schirass [Shiraz] and all business is suspended until he arrives there.
